name: csc
content:

Add to word list
abbreviation for card security code: a number on a credit card or debit card (= a card used for payment), usually three digits (= individual numbers) on the back of the card, that is used to prove that the person making the payment has the card in their possession: The CSC is not printed on any receipts, so it is not likely to be known by anyone other than the actual card owner. Can I have the CSC number from the back of your card, please?
More examplesFewer examplesWe ask you to fill out the CSC to avoid anyone other than you from shopping with your card number.The CSC number is not part of the actual card number.The CSC is used as a security feature, in situations where a personal identification number (PIN) cannot be used. The CSC (card security code) is typically the last three or four digits printed, not embossed like the card number, on the signature strip on the back of the card.The growth in phishing has reduced the real-world effectiveness of the CSC as an anti-fraud device.
